column1: MVR001: Does your company have a system/process for tracking the secure storage of removable media to manage retention and disposal processes?
column4: Integral does have a system/process for tracking the secure storage of removable media to manage retention and disposal processes in place. Audited under SOC.
column5:
Integral Development Corporation does have a system/process for tracking the secure storage of removable media to manage retention and disposal processes in place.



Assessor work steps: 
The assessor's comments were completed through review of the Third Party response.

column1:
MVR002: Does your company have a procedure for the disposal, destruction and reuse of physical media, removable media and paper documents?
Artifact Required: Example destruction of media and assets log/destruction certificates
column4:
Integral does have a procedure for the disposal, destruction and/or reuse of physical media, removable media and paper documents. Procedure is audited under SOC.
1. Procedures are in place to securely dispose of sensitive media (removable/physical).
2. Use of tools of secure disposal of both paper and electronic media
column5:
Integral Development Corporation does have a procedure for the disposal, destruction and/or reuse of physical media, removable media and paper documents.

Integral has not destroyed any media within the past two years so, they did not have a certificate of destruction to share. 

The following design elements are in place:
1. Procedures are in place to securely dispose of sensitive media (removable/physical).
    Integral Development 2020 SOC 1 and ISAE 3402 Type 2 Report.pdf [Stage 5] - Page 37, CC 7.1

2. Shred bins and cross shredders are available 
    New Security Text 0121.pdf [Stage 5] - Page 12, Section: Records Management 

3. Use of tools of secure disposal of both paper and electronic media
    New Security Text 0121.pdf [Stage 5] - Page 12, Section: Records Management

4. Electronic media is degaussed before disposal
    New Security Text 0121.pdf [Stage 5] - Page 12, Section: Data Destruction Policy 

5. If secure destruction is outsourced, certificates of destruction are received from third party. - Shred-It completes on-site visits. 
    New Security Text 0121.pdf [Stage 5] - Page 12, Section: Data Destruction Policy

6. Overwriting sensitive information prior to reuse
    New Security Text 0121.pdf [Stage 5] - Page 12, Section: Records Management

7. Maintaining audit trails of disposed equipment and media
    New Security Text 0121.pdf [Stage 5] - Page 12, Section: Records Management


The assessor observed the New Security Text Policy in place. 

Assessor work steps: 
The assessor's comments were completed through review of the Third Party response, observation of evidence and inquiry with Seeja Jiju, Program Manager on 07/23/2021.

Evidence referenced:
Integral Development 2020 SOC 1 and ISAE 3402 Type 2 Report.pdf [Stage 5] 
New Security Text 0121.pdf [Stage 5]

column1:
MVR003: Does your company have a Data and Records Retention Program, Policy, or Procedure?

If yes, please attach.
Artifact Required: Data Retention Policy

Design Elements:
1. Identifies or alludes to the laws and regulations that must be met by their data retention requirements
2. Includes types and classifications of all records, data, and information that are subject to data retention requirements are identified
column4:
Integral does have a data and/or records retention program, policy, or procedure in place.
1. Identifies or alludes to the laws and regulations that must be met by their data retention requirements
2. Includes types and classifications of all records, data, and information that are subject to data retention requirements are identified
    Compliance Manual (Section:  Confidentiality and data protection)
column5:
Integral Development Corporation does have a data and/or records retention program, policy, or procedure in place.

The following design elements are in place:
1. Identifies or alludes to the laws and regulations that must be met by their data retention requirements
    Compliance Manual (updated as at 20210429).docx [Stage 5] - Page 19, Section 9:  Confidentiality and data protection

2. Includes types and classifications of all records, data, and information that are subject to data retention requirements are identified
    Compliance Manual (updated as at 20210429).pdf [Stage 5] - Page 19, Section 9:  Confidentiality and data protection




Assessor work steps: 
The assessor's comments were completed through review of the Third Party response and inspection of evidence.

Evidence referenced:
Compliance Manual (updated as at 20210429).docx [Stage 5] 
Compliance Manual (updated as at 20210429).pdf [Stage 5]
